alert.note: Alert for Sussex (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 27 at 11:16AM EDT until June 28 at 2:00AM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 215 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of northern New Jersey...including the following counties...Morris and Sussex. * WHEN...Until 215 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1114 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated moderate to heavy rain due to showers and thunderstorms. The rain is falling across the same areas that received heavy rain yesterday. Overflowing poor drainage areas will cause minor flooding across portions of the advisory area. Between 0.5 and 1 inch of rain has fallen the last hour. - Some locations that may experience flooding include... Newton, Dover, Hopatcong, Wharton, Rockaway, Mount Arlington, Franklin, Mendham, Stanhope, Hamburg, Netcong, and Ogdensburg. - This includes the following highways... Interstate 80 in New Jersey between mile markers 23 and 37. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route.
